question: 秀でる
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>excel</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to excel</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

"<reading>He-e</reading> (<ja>ひい</ja>) is going <vocabulary>to excel</vocabulary>," you stutter. "He-e is!"
